data.title: Intimate and inexpensive improv comedy
data.text: Very funny improv show. Really inexpensive.  For the money - totally worth it.  Very intimate as you are feet from the performers even if you're in the back row.  Heads up that there are some shady characters milling around outside and on the corner of broadway and Burnside.  Be prepared to walk with purpose. Very cool show, we'd do it again.

data.title: Sooooooo funny!
data.text: I have been going to this improv comedy theater for more than 15 years, and they have never failed to make me laugh really hard.  They are making up plays or short skits as they go, and it is so well done I still have to remind myself they are making it up as they go!  There are also some stand-up comedy shows that include great comics, and some shows that include both stand-up and improv.  There's a very good full bar and a small kitchen--a few sandwiches, good but nothing fancy.

data.title: Great theater space, very talented improv/standup artists.
data.text: First time for us at the Brody Theater in Portland ... parking north of Burnside on Broadway or nearby streets was not a problem New Years Eve.  Make reservations online PayPal or in person; found it hard to get past the telephone menu.  And then show up when doors open, typically half an hour before the show.  There are two rows of very comfortable dining room chairs with a variety of seating behind them and around the back bar ... even a sofa off in a corner.  We sat second row center and for this show it was perfect.  Several standup comics, a script reading preview, and several fast and very clever improv acts.  The three hour show was nicely broken with 10 minute breaks.  A spacious and easily accessible bathroom is along a wall between the stage and the bar.  Drinks available, and free water, too.    Superb!

data.title: Good place to get your funny on.
data.text: Brody Theater is all about comedy.  The have stand up comedy shows, open mic nights; also workshops and improv classes. It's not the most attractive place - a bit dingy in fact and not big at all. It's more of an intimate setting with a bar, tables and chairs. If you like to laugh, or make other people laugh, this is a great place to do it.

data.title: Laughed So Hard I Cried
data.text:
If the title doesn't sum it up, go anyway =) & get there early for good seats.
Pretty limited menu, but the grilled cheese with tomato & pesto was pretty good.
